definition: to warm up/to heat up/hot (of weather)/heat/fervent
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to

sentences.english: Other things being equal, iron heats up faster than aluminum.
sentences.chinese: 其他条件相同时，铁比铝热得快。

sentences.english: Other things being equal, copper heats up faster than iron.
sentences.chinese: 其他条件相同时，铜比铁热得快。

sentences.english: hasty love is soon hot and soon cold.
sentences.chinese: 闪电似的恋爱热得快，冷的也快。

sentences.english: Hasty love is soon hot and shortly cold.
sentences.chinese: 草轻率率谈恋爱，热得快也冷得快。

sentences.english: Would you please turn on the air conditioner right now?
sentences.chinese: 我热得快化了，赶快把空调打开吧。

sentences.english: Hey, I'm melting. Would you please turn on the air conditioner right now?
sentences.chinese: 我热得快化了，赶快把空调打开吧。

sentences.english: Other things being equal , iron heats up faster than aluminium.
sentences.chinese: 如果其他情况相同，则铁比铝热得快。

sentences.english: Hasty love is soon hot while in thetensely quickly cold.
sentences.chinese: 草鲁莽率谈恋爱，热得快也冷得快。

sentences.english: Other things being equal, iron heats upfaster than aluminium.
sentences.chinese: 其他条件相同时，铁比铝热得快。

sentences.english: For example, three of these fires were caused by the students' use of electric water-heaters.
sentences.chinese: 比如，其中三起事故都是由于学生使用热得快引起的。

definition: thermos bottle/vacuum bottle/hot water dispenser (appliance)/CL:個|个[ge4]
to leak electricity/(fig.) (coll.) to unintentionally arouse romantic interest (by being solicitous etc)/cf. 放電|放电[fang4 dian4]
